definition[0]: the ash that remains when a dead personâ€™s body is burned
example[0]: His ashes were scattered at sea.
definition[1]: a situation in which something is completely destroyed
example[1]: The organization has risen from the ashes to become very successful.
example[2]: All her hopes and dreams had turned to ashes.
definition[2]: the name given to the competition between the English and Australian cricket teams
example[3]: Australia have retained the Ashes for the third year running.
